data.chText: 马刺；靴刺
data.enText: a sharp pointed object that riders sometimes wear on the heels of their boots and use to encourage their horse to go faster

data.chText: 鞭策；激励；刺激；鼓舞
data.enText: a fact or an event that makes you want to do sth better or more quickly

data.chText: 他的讲话很有鼓动力。
data.enText: His speech was a powerful spur to action.

data.chText: 山嘴；尖坡；支脉
data.enText: an area of high ground that sticks out from a mountain or hill

data.chText: （公路或铁路的）支线，岔线
data.enText: a road or a railway/railroad track that leads from the main road or line
on the spur of the moment

data.chText: 一时冲动之下；心血来潮
data.enText: suddenly, without planning in advance

data.chText: 我一时心动，给他打了电话。
data.enText: I phoned him up on the spur of the moment.

data.chText: 心血来潮的决定
data.enText: a spur-of-the-moment decision
win/earn your spurs

data.chText: 获得名望；取得成功
data.enText: to achieve fame or success

data.chText: 鞭策；激励；刺激；鼓舞
data.enText: to encourage sb to do sth or to encourage them to try harder to achieve sth

data.chText: 她艰辛的童年激励她取得成功。
data.enText: Her difficult childhood spurred her on to succeed.

data.chText: 那封信激励我行动起来。
data.enText: I was spurred into action by the letter.

data.chText: 最近一张单曲唱片的成功使乐队受到鼓舞。
data.enText: The band has been spurred on by the success of their last single.

data.chText: 促进，加速，刺激（某事发生）
data.enText: to make sth happen faster or sooner

data.chText: 这项协议对于促进世界经济的增长是至关重要的。
data.enText: The agreement is essential to spurring economic growth around the world.

data.chText: 策（马）前进；（尤指用马刺）策（马）加速
data.enText: to encourage a horse to go faster, especially by pushing the spurs on your boots into its side

means: 促进，加速，刺激(某事发生)

data.enText: on the spur of the moment

data.chText: 一时冲动之下；心血来潮
data.enText: suddenly, without planning in advance

data.chText: 我一时心动，给他打了电话。
data.enText: I phoned him up on the spur of the moment.

data.chText: 心血来潮的决定
data.enText: a spur-of-the-moment decision
win/earn your spurs

data.chText: 获得名望；取得成功
data.enText: to achieve fame or success

tr: a railway line connected to a trunk line
a sharp prod fixed to a rider's heel and used to urge a horse onward
example: cowboys know not to squat with their spurs on

tr: a verbalization that encourages you to attempt something
example: the ceaseless prodding got on his nerves

tr: tubular extension at the base of the corolla in some flowers

example: The Academy was formed to spur research

value.def: If one thing spurs you to do another, it encourages you to do it.

example.ex: It's the money that spurs these fishermen to risk a long ocean journey in their flimsy boats...
example.tran: 是金钱驱使这些渔民驾着破旧小船冒险出海远航。

example.ex: His friend's  plight had spurred him into taking part.
example.tran: 朋友的困境促使他投身参与。

example.ex: Their attitude, rather than reining him back, only seemed to spur Philip on...
example.tran: 他们的态度非但没有令菲利普回头，反倒促使他继续向前。

example.ex: Criticism can be of great use; we may not like it at the time, but it can spur us on to greater things.
example.tran: 批评可能会很有用;我们当时可能不喜欢它，但它能激励我们获取更大成功。

gramarinfo.label: Also V P n (not pron), V n P to-inf

value.def: If something spurs a change or event, it makes it happen faster or sooner.

example.ex: The administration may put more emphasis on spurring economic growth...
example.tran: 政府可能会更加重视推动经济增长。

example.ex: The trade pacts will spur an exodus of US businesses to Mexico.
example.tran: 这些贸易协定将会促使大批美国企业涌向墨西哥。

value.def: Something that acts as a spur to something else encourages a person or organization to do that thing or makes it happen more quickly.

example.ex: ...a belief in competition as a spur to efficiency...
example.tran: 认为竞争会促进效率的信念

example.ex: Redundancy is the spur for many to embark on new careers.
example.tran: 裁员促使很多人开始从事新事业。

value.def: Spurs are small metal wheels with sharp points that are attached to the heels of a rider's boots. The rider uses them to make their horse go faster.
The spur of a hill or mountain is a piece of ground which sticks out from its side.
If you do something on the spur of the moment, you do it suddenly, without planning it beforehand.

example.ex: They admitted they had taken a vehicle on the spur of the moment...
example.tran: 他们承认是一时冲动偷走了一辆车。

example.ex: It wasn't a spur-of-the-moment decision. We discussed it in detail beforehand.
example.tran: 这可不是头脑一热作出的决定。我们事先仔细地讨论过。

value.def: If you win your spurs or earn your spurs, you achieve a particular status by proving that you can do something skilfully.

example.ex: Young conductors earn their spurs in a small orchestra or opera house.
example.tran: 年轻的指挥家们在小乐队或小歌剧院里崭露头角。
